title: Active shooter at Cascade Mall in Burlington, Washington
content:
A man armed with a rifle has opened fire at the Cascade Mall in Burlington, Washington, killing four women and one man, state police say. The suspected gunman is still at large and his motive is unknown. (more)
FOR LIVE UPDATES: Twitter, Facebook
The incident began just before 7 p.m. PT on Friday when an unidentified man - believed to be between 20 and 25 years old and armed with a rifle - opened fire inside Macy's at the Cascade Mall. Details about the circumstances of the shooting are still unclear.
Customers at the mall reported being put on lockdown and said they were hiding inside the stores as a large number of officers rushed to the scene and surrounded the mall. Roads in the area have been closed by police.
Sgt. Mark Francis, a spokesman for the Washington State Patrol, confirmed that four women had been killed at Macy's. A fifth victim, a man, was airlifted to Harborview Medical Center in very critical condition and succumbed to his injuries on Saturday morning.
Sgt. Francis said the shooter is believed to have fled the mall, though officers continued searching the scene as a precaution while they treated it as an active shooter situation. The mall had been mostly cleared just before midnight.
The suspected shooter is described as a skinny Hispanic male, between 20 and 25 years old, with black hair and a black shirt. He was last seen running towards Interstate 5, which is directly adjacent to the Cascade Mall. A photo of the suspect was released just after 9 p.m. (posted below).
As of early Saturday morning, authorities urged area residents to stay inside and to call 911 immediately if they see the suspect. People who are concerned about their loved ones are advised to go to "His Place" church, where survivors have been taken.
Details about a possible motive for the mall shooting were not immediately known, but FBI spokeswoman Ayn Dietrich-Williams said the agency's Joint Terrorism Task Force is not responding to the incident, though other FBI agents are.
"At this time, we do not have information to suggest additional attacks [are] planned in Washington," she said.
"The FBI has personnel on the way to assist the Skagit Multi Agency Response Team in its investigation of this evening's incident at Cascade Mall," the spokeswoman added. "The FBI will help as needed, whether it be in extra manpower, tactical resources, or intelligence-gathering."
A SWAT situation was also underway in downtown Seattle, possibly as a lead in the investigation into the Burlington shooting, but the situation ended at about 11:45 p.m. PT.
Washington Governor Jay Inslee, in a written statement, said "tragedy has struck" the state. "Many questions remain but our state patrol and local law enforcement are on the scene working swiftly to locate the shooter and clear the area," he said.
Inslee added: "Trudi and I send our condolences to the families of the victims and prayers for anyone injured .. Stay close to your friends and loved ones as we await more information and, hopefully, news of the suspect's capture."
